phrases: I figured that William boy must have met up with you.
Perhaps I said too much and scared him off.
It might sound conceited of me to say so, but I do not think that is the case.
Well... sometimes, trying to be considerate can make a person hesitate...
But, he should at least see you off!
So you are going to retire from being a governess?
I am getting on in years.
I need to take things easier.
Oh, she is a girl who was living on the streets.
She here came looking for work, so I use her for simple jobs.
Which reminds me, I have been wanting a maid.
Come now Kelly, you cannot be serious.
She is not the type you can train to be a maid.
I have always wondered how much can be accomplished through education.
I will teach you everything from scratch.
It is fine with you, I trust?
Do not blame me if you regret it.
It takes a lot for father to raise his hand against someone.
But it was bound to happen sooner or later.
Like they say, if it rains before 7, it will be fine by 1 1.
Brother Will will be fine soon, too.
So there is no need to fret.
Well, sir... he appears to be in his room, but...
Oh, you have finally decided to come out.
Only because I wanted to get away.
When she really needed someone by her side...
I could not be there for her.
Did l... ever really know her?
I was only thinking of myself.
I did not consider what would make Emma happy.
Well... I wanted to consider her feelings.
But Emma was suffering so badly.
Even if I decided to marry Emma, she would have to take on the Jones name.
She would be bound by the strict traditions of polite society, exposed to the curiosity of others...
Sacrificing so much, would Emma ever really be happy marrying me, I wonder?
Am I even a worthy partner for Emma?
I become too afraid to face her.
Go ahead and call me spineless.
You are not prepared to lose Emma, yet you keep acting all melodramatic.
You are overdoing it a bit, are not you?
You asked me to say it.
I do not understand you at all.
More importantly, if you do not hurry and stop Emma, you will never see her again.
Emma said she was going back to her childhood home.
Why did not you say that sooner?
Because I did not really want to tell you.
I was told to ask you out for a ride, but there must have been some mistake...
It does not have to be today, or tomorrow.
So please, invite me out again...
Do not be stubborn about it.
That is Kings Cross station, right?
That would be dangerous, we are in the middle of the city.
Oh, I am afraid third class is full.
We still have second class tickets.
If you would have come just a bit earlier you might have gotten into third class.
It is only a difference of 5 or 6 shillings.
One first class round-trip ticket to York.
Well, that will have to do.
They are two for a penny!
This is the engine of the Midland Railways...
It can hit 50 miles an hour!
You are not supposed to doodle there!
Oh, it seems we have got the wrong number.
We still have time to change it, so please hurry back to the ticket window.
I mistook you for someone else.
It is really crowded over there too!
Whatever shall I do with you, Madam?
I wonder if you will notice this letter...
That we must part this way... it is my one regret.
However, my heart now feels strangely peaceful and calm.
Even though our love crossed classes and was never meant to be,
that our hearts have touched in this way...
The memories we shared will stay with me, always.
No matter how far away I am, I will always pray for your happiness.
May the grace of God go with you.
The train is about to depart.
May the grace of God go with you.
It is a lily of the valley, is not it?
Yes... though I am not sure why I bought it.
Oh, do not worry about that!
Flowers are great to have anywhere.
In the language of flowers, that lily is wonderful, too.
Do you know what it means?
It means that happiness will return.
